titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. D. A. Layman, Judgment

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
Kenton Circuit Court
June Term 22d June 1861.
Comth.. vs D. A. Layman --

Came the parties and the Defendant being put upon his Defense pleaded not guilty, thereupon came a jury towit A. T. Whitake H. D Linman J. E. Lett John Mackay W. C. Cullertson Isaac Cooper Jno Coleman Wm McGlanon A. D. Groom, W. H. Glore Saml. Craighead & C. B. Brashear, who being Duly sworn will and truly to try the issue after having the evidence and argument of counsel returned the following verdict -- "We the jury find the Defendant Guilty of shooting Charles Larned in sudden, affray and fix his punishment at a fine of One hundred & twenty five Dollars --

Wherefore it is adjudged that the Defendant make his fine (to the Commonwealth in the sum of $125 -- and that the Commonwealth recover of said Defendant her costs herein expended and that he be committed to Jail at the rate of $2. per Day until the fine is paid -- --

A copy attest
N B Stephens Clk

Remitted as to one half of the term of the fine --
B. M

Kenton Cir. Ct
$125.
D. A Layman
Issd July 9 1861
